shortdesc.ph: Stops or resumes subscribing to the audio stream of a specified remote user.
Unsubscribes from or resumes the audio stream of a specified remote user.
Stops or resumes subscribing to the audio stream of a specified remote user.
Stops or resumes subscribing to the audio stream of a specified remote user.

p.codeblock: abstract muteRemoteAudioStream(uid: number, mute: boolean): number;
abstract muteRemoteAudioStream(uid: number, mute: boolean): number;
Future<void> muteRemoteAudioStream({required int uid, required bool mute});
public abstract int MuteRemoteAudioStream(uint uid, bool mute);

plentry.pd: User ID. Must be the same as the user ID used when joining the channel.

Whether to stop subscribing to the specified remote user's audio stream.
: Stop subscribing to the specified user's audio stream.
: (Default) Subscribe to the specified user's audio stream. The SDK determines whether to subscribe based on the distance between the local and remote users.
User ID. Must be the same as the user ID used when the user joined the channel.

Whether to unsubscribe from the specified remote user's audio stream.
: Unsubscribe from the specified user's audio stream.
: (Default) Subscribe to the specified user's audio stream. The SDK determines whether to subscribe based on the distance between the local and remote users.
The user ID. It must be the same as the user ID used when the user joins the channel.

Whether to stop subscribing to the specified remote user's audio stream:
: Stop subscribing to the specified user's audio stream.
: (Default) Subscribe to the specified user's audio stream. The SDK determines whether to subscribe based on the distance between the local and remote users.
User ID. Must be the same as the ID used when the user joined the channel.

Whether to stop subscribing to the audio stream of the specified remote user.
: Stop subscribing to the specified user's audio stream.
: (Default) Subscribe to the specified user's audio stream. The SDK determines whether to subscribe based on the distance between the local and remote users.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when it fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and troubleshooting.
